title: HSBC may axe even more than 10,000 jobs as profits slide
text:
HSBC, which is preparing to cut thousands of jobs, has admitted that its previous restructuring plans are "no longer sufficient" after a difficult few months.

Interim chief executive Noel Quinn said he was "accelerating plans" to overhaul areas where performance was "not acceptable" as the bank announced an 18pc fall in pre-tax profit to $4.8bn (£3.7bn) for the third quarter. Only $100m of that figure was generated outside Asia.

The poor results have increased fears over job cuts in Europe and the US. Earlier this year analysts said that the UK, where HSBC's Canary Wharf office is known by some staff as the “Tower of Doom”, could bear the brunt of fresh plans to slash an estimated 10,000 roles....
